Not in real life, I should add - where they are hardworking and one time one helped me catch and kill cockroach even though we didn't speak the same language - but in the game This Bed We Made, a third person mystery set in a slightly grimy 1950s hotel. The reason why you shouldn't trust this particular cleaner because it is, in fact, you, in the kitten heels of Sophie here, as you rifle through their belongings and ogle at their undies. There's a demo of one such room on Steam now, and it plops you right in medias of some juicy res.
Read more
articles.title: This cool 50s noir game lets you do the job of a hotel cleaner (aka: solve a mystery)

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
Just yesterday, June 1st, early access for Diablo IV officially began for owners of the Ultimate and Digital Deluxe editions. But the biggest news for PC players is how surprisingly stable the launch has been. So far. Fingers crossed for the full launch on June 6th. There have been some annoying licensing errors affecting console friends (and a few PC players too), but with the disastrous launch of Diablo III in mind, early access hack n’ slashers can let out a sigh of relief that lightning hasn’t struck twice.

 
Read more
articles.title: Oh wow, Diablo 4 has had a surprisingly smooth launch so far

articles.author: Sin Vega
articles.description:
I'm unsure whether to call Raid On Taihoku a "historical game", since it's an adventure game with enough daftness to feel a bit unlike what that phrase brings to mind. But it's set very thoroughly in Taiwan towards the end of World War II, and though the focus is a young girl's relationship with her family and friends, that context is critical to why I've enjoyed it so much.
Taxonomy aside, then, the important thing is that it's enjoyable. It hasn't hit the emotional highs of the kind of interactive fiction I favour, but for a story with such heavy themes, it provides a relaxing drip feed of mystery reveals and plot thickenings in between low-pressure minigames. It's a good time, without undermining its obvious respect for the people who had to live through this.
Read more
articles.title: Raid On Taihoku is strangely relaxing for such a grim setting

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
Take one good look at the upcoming Catch & Cook: Fishing Adventure and you might just mistake it for 2023’s other third-person cartoony fishing sim: Dredge. The big-toothed mutants and otherworldly horrors in Dredge can get quite overwhelming though, especially when they start to chomp at your ship beneath the surface. After playing Catch & Cook’s recently released demo, I’m happy to report that it’s the ideal fishing sim for people who find Dredge’s spooky undercurrents, erm, too spooky. Just a very chill, very good time. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Chill fishing sim Catch & Cook looks a lot like Dredge without the spooky undercurrents

articles.author: Katharine Castle
articles.description:
It's time for the next gathering of the RPS Game Club! From 4pm BST today, June 2nd, we'll be chatting about all things Citizen Sleeper - your favourite moments, your most heart-breaking questlines, and lots more. We've been having a swell time revisiting one of our favourite games from last year for this month's Game Club, and we hope you've had fun playing it as well. So why not come and join in the discussion? See you at 4pm sharp! 
 Read more
articles.title: Chat about Citizen Sleeper with us in RPS Game Club today

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
Continuing their annual tradition, developer Don’t Nod have announced that all three episodes of Tell Me Why will be free to keep for the rest of June. Rather than spending money on the game, the team asks that you might consider donating that money to “trans creators, trans-inclusive charities local to you, and trans people in need,” in honour of Pride Month. Regardless, the supernatural mystery is one of the best recent adventure games and is well worth the time. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Episodic adventure Tell Me Why is free to keep for all of Pride Month

articles.author: Callum Bains
articles.description:
David Brevik, now the president of Skystone Games, did not expect to encounter a doppelganger when he arrived at Chicago’s Consumer Electronic Show in the summer of 1994. He’d come to the tech expo with Condor, a studio he’d co-founded only a few months prior, to show off Justice League: Task Force. A humble fighting game in the vein of Street Fighter, it was given a small demo booth and placed next to another game that featured a cast of superheroes, a strikingly similar visual style and, much to Brevik’s surprise, the very same name.


Without their knowing, Condor were one of two studios hired to develop the DC Comics tie-in: their Sega Mega Drive/Genesis version set to release alongside a SNES title made by another recently formed team, Silicon & Synapse. “We'd never talked to them,” Brevik says. “We'd never interacted with them. We didn't know there was even another version, and then we show up at the booth and they're side by side, and we're like, this is really weird.” They didn't know it yet, but these Justice League sort-of clones were the first paving stones on the road to the Diablo series. 

 
Read more
articles.title: How claymation, an X-COM screenshot and a Justice League tie-in game brought us Diablo

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
The Ukrainian studio working on S.T.A.L.K.E.R 2: Heart Of Chernobyl, GSC Game World, have confirmed that early development materials from the game have been leaked online, following “about a year and a half” worth of attacks from a Russian hacking group. GSC say that the materials aren’t “release-ready,” but looking at the leaked clips may “ruin your experience of exploring the Zone.” 

 
Read more
articles.title: S.T.A.L.K.E.R 2 test footage has leaked online after "a year and a half” of hacker attacks

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
The Meta Quest 3 is very much real and releasing this autumn, according to apparently of-this-world executive Mark Zuckerberg. The followup to the Oculus/Meta Quest 2, which despite its advanced age is still one of the best VR gaming headsets, is a full-on mixed reality kit, taking advantage of its new all-colour passthrough to enable AR gaming as well as 'traditional' VR play.
Read more
articles.title: Meta Quest 3 announced: mixed reality headset launching this year for £500

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
The season of big video game announcements - otherwise known as NotE3 season - is in full swing and Ubisoft have decided to join the trailer festivities by teasing their own showcase. The Ubisoft Forward show will be broadcast live from Los Angeles on June 12th at 6pm BST/10am PDT, with a pre-show starting 15 minutes earlier. The publisher also released a small clip to confirm that AssCreed, Avatar, and The Crew: Motorfest will all make an appearance, alongside a non-descript mystery game. Take a peek below. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Ubisoft Forward 2023 confirms fresh looks at Avatar, Assassin's Creed, and new mystery game

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
Redfall suffered from a tumultuous development cycle where developers from Arkane Austin hoped that Microsoft would either reboot or cancel the project, according to a new report from Bloomberg. The co-op shooter launched to mostly negative reviews last month, which was uncharacteristic of Arkane’s usually excellent pedigree.

 
Read more
articles.title: Redfall's development sure sounds like a hot mess, according to new report

articles.author: Will Judd
articles.description:
EPOS make some of the best gaming headsets in the business, so it's great to see a deep discount on one of their best Sennheiser co-creations. The GSP 600 offers extremely good build quality, great audio and incredible noise isolation too. 
Its list price is a faintly ridiculous $219, but right now you can pick up a brand new set of these headphones for $54.99 at Woot. That's a solid $15 off the same set on Amazon, and a great price for headphones of this level of quality. 
Read more
articles.title: The EPOS Sennheiser GSP 600 is down to $54.99 in the US

articles.author: Will Judd
articles.description:
Intel's mid-range Core i5 processors have long been some of the best choices for gaming PCs, versus Core i7 and Core i9 models that require much more cooling while not providing much more performance in GPU-limited scenarios. Their 13th-gen models are a particular favourite, and today we have a US deal on perhaps the best value gaming CPU in that lineup: the Core i5 13400F is now down to $164.99 at Best Buy following a $50 discount. 
Read more
articles.title: Intel's Core i5 13400F is down to $165 after a $50 Best Buy discount

articles.author: Rebecca Jones
articles.description:
When RPS awarded Kentucky Route Zero the title of Game Of The Year in 2013, only two episodes out of an eventual five had been released. If this sounds like a bland statement of fact, just think about it for a second. I can't recall any other time an episodic adventure game has received GOTY-level praise before it was even concluded, let alone only 40% done.
Episodes three through five arrived sporadically: in spring 2014, summer 2016, and — after what must have been an agonising hiatus — the start of 2020. Having bypassed this wait to play the game for the first time only recently, I feel wistfully as though I'll never share quite the same fond feelings for it as contemporary fans (like our own reviews ranger Rachel, who recently named KRZ one of her all-time favourite indie games). But I'm also quite relieved that I didn't have to exercise that kind of patience. I mean, I'm very good at neglecting to carry on with games for years at a time despite thoroughly enjoying what I've played so far. But I like doing it on my terms, you know?
I initially attempted to do something a bit clever with this retrospective. I wanted to play the first two episodes that earned KRZ our GOTY nod in 2013, and write up on them as a discrete entity as far as possible. Only then did I plan to carry on the game and add some follow-up impressions, perhaps assessing whether I thought RPS would still award the big chocolate medal to the full game as it finally came to be in 2020. But, after sitting with my feelings about Episodes 1-2 for a couple of weeks, any intelligent observations I might have made were drowned out by an increasingly loud, insistent voice in the back of my head howling: "I WANT TO KNOW WHAT HAPPENS." Actually, that might be a good impression to just let stand on its own merits.
 Read more
articles.title: RPS GOTY Revisited: 2013's Kentucky Route Zero goes nowhere fast, and that's why we love it

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
Somehow we’re already in June, which makes me both cosmically confused about the passage of time and quite happy because it’s now Pride Month. That also means that queer indie developers have once again banded together and organised the third annual Queer Games Bundle on Itch.io, offering over 450 video games, board games, zines, books, soundtracks, and other creative stuff for the price of one AAA game: $60. All proceeds are split between the participating developers, and there’s some very cool stuff included. 


“Purchasing the Queer Games Bundle is a direct action that you can take right now to support queer people in a life-changing way,” reads the bundle's description, “and in exchange, you get over 450 amazing, heartfelt, fun, and radical games and artworks.”

 
Read more
articles.title: The Queer Games Bundle returns to Itch.io, collecting hundreds of games for Pride Month

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Mere spec sheets? Old news, friend. This Steam Deck vs Asus ROG Ally comparison is new and improved with actual testing results, both hard data (I may even borrow some benchmark graphs from the ROG Ally review) and those of the observational/anecdotal/downright take-y variety. Hopefully, by the end of it, these will give you a far better idea of which handheld gaming PC will suit your travelling needs, performance preferences, or even specific games to play on the go.
Read more
articles.title: Steam Deck vs Asus ROG Ally: a handheld head-to-head

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
The Lord Of The Rings: Gollum turned out to be a hot mess. Who knew? The Electronic Wireless Show podcast is on hand to do a dramatic reading of the developer apology post, and talk about the reception to the game - plus our favourite Lord Of The Rings Games, and our favourite apologies. In a shocking twist, James turns out to not be a LotR fan. He is useless to me. I will let you know when we discover things he does like.
We've also been playing some video games this week, how about that! Including the click-fest game of the moment, the remake game of the moment, and a whole other thing I hadn't heard of. So actually James does have a use after all. Plus: he finally got hold of a ROG Ally!
Read more
articles.title: The Electronic Wireless Show S2 Episode 18: Gollum's very sorry, precious

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Despite all the fun that could obviously be had unleashing rampaging sphynxs and hippo-headed warriors on the battlefields of Total War: Pharaoh, Creative Assembly Sofia are currently steadfast in keeping their latest historical release firmly in the realm of history, with “absolutely no plans'' to release a similar expansion to Troy’s Mythos, which added magic and minotaurs to the otherwise relatively grounded Aegean setting.

 
Read more
articles.title: Creative Assembly have “absolutely no plans” to bring ancient Egyptian mythology to Total War: Pharaoh

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Despite a name evoking the opulent leaders of one of history's most famous (and, as I’d soon learn, famously misunderstood) civilisations, Total War: Pharaoh's aspirations don’t start and end with ancient Egypt. Moreso, the next mainline historical Total War aims to capture the struggles and instability of a time period for which ancient Egypt simply had the best seat in the house. “We wanted to make a game about the collapse of the Bronze Age,” Creative Assembly Sofia’s  Milcho Vasilev, lead battle designer on Total War: Pharaoh, tells me. “There’s a lot of mystery surrounding it, and we wanted to uncover it.”

 
Read more
articles.title: Total War: Pharaoh may not have war hippos, but it has fire, shoving, and deep history

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
Metroidvanias, Metroid-likes, and Castlevania-likes are games that heavily feature non-linear exploration and cool discoveries that open up parts of an interconnected map. Otherwise known as good game design. A new Humble Bundle has now compiled seven great Metroidvanias for the low price of £12/$15, available here from now until June 20th. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Humble's Metroidvania Bundle includes seven bangers for only $15

articles.author: Rebecca Jones
articles.description:
Somehow it's June already, which means it's time for the Indiescovery crew to suppress our existential dread at the fleetingness of existence and take a look at our favourite indie games from the first (almost) half of 2023! Don't worry, we very quickly realise that June has such a slammed line-up we can probably give it a best-games episode all of its own to make up for the fact that we tackled this topic a bit early.
Listen and subscribe via your podcast provider of choice! Find us on RSS feed, Spotify, Apple Podcasts, Google Podcasts, Pocket Casts, Amazon Music, TuneIn, Deezer, and YouTube.
 Read more
articles.title: Indiescovery Episode 11: Our favourite indie games of 2023 so far

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
The widely admired studio behind XCOM and Civilization, Firaxis Games, have undergone a round of layoffs affecting around 30 employees, according to a report from Axios. Publisher 2K Games later confirmed the news and said the job cuts were due to a “sharpening of focus, enhancements of efficiencies, and an alignment of our talent against our highest priorities."

 
Read more
articles.title: XCOM and Civilization studio Firaxis Games suffers a round of layoffs

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
Arcade racer Hot Wheels Unleashed 2: Turbocharged is speeding our way on October 19th, developer Milestone have announced. Like the first surprisingly great game, you’ll race over 130 toy cars through real-world locations, zooming past dinner tables, out of windows, and across gardens. Seems like more good fun, whether you’re a five-year-old or a five-year-old stuck in an adult's body.

 
Read more
articles.title: Hot Wheels Unleashed 2: Turbocharged ups the chaos and vehicular destruction this year

articles.author: Liam Richardson
articles.description:
I put olives in my bolognese. Olives, objectively, do not belong in a bolognese. But without fail, I’ll dunk half a jar of those salty little bad boys into my bubbling wok without hesitation. Peppers? Why not. Carrot? Absolutely. Spinach? Don’t mind if I do. My bolognese is about as authentically Italian as Super Mario, but it doesn’t matter. I’m not trying to make Massimo Bottura cry by reminding him of his nonna’s cooking. It’s a dreary Tuesday night and I’m craving my olive-laden concoction. I’m making this bolognese just for me.


Slayers X: Terminal Aftermath: Vengance of the Slayer reminded me a lot of my bolognese. It’s a game created for particular tastes, a unique proposition that sort of defies conventional thinking. A big, bold swing that -  if you have the palate for it - is absolutely brilliant.

 
Read more
articles.title: Slayers X: Terminal Aftermath: Vengance of the Slayer review: a boisterous Hypnospace spin-off that's an obnoxious gem

articles.author: Alice O'Connor
articles.description:
Last time, you decided that a silent protagonist is better than combat style ratings. Not by much! It was a 60/40 split, and I'm surprised/glad it was this close. We are now one decision closer to knowing the best thing. This week, I ask you to choose between a matter concerning movement, and what an enemy does in response to when and how you move. What's better: an enemy which can't see you but can sense you, or it only moves when you're not looking?
Read more
articles.title: What's better: An enemy which can't see you but can sense you, or it only moves when you're not looking?

articles.author: Will Judd
articles.description:
DDR5 RAM used to be expensive - but fast forward a year or two and now it's possible to pick up 16GB for a little more than three of your British tenners. That's right, you can now get a single 16GB stick of DDR5-4800 for £34, or two for £68 - quick maths. 
This is by far the best choice when it comes to raw price versus performance, and allows you to build out a DDR5 Intel or AMD system at the absolute minimum cost while still getting a healthy 32GB.   
Read more
articles.title: Get 16GB of Crucial DDR5 RAM for £34

articles.author: Will Judd
articles.description:
As AMD's (underwhelming) mid-range RX 7000 graphics cards are being released, we're seeing extremely good discounts on their past-gen offerings, making them significantly better value. Case in point is this deal on the MSI RX 6800, which is a great card for 1440p to 4K gaming and now costs just £430. That's £260 cheaper than the same card cost at the end of April, reflecting a heck of a savings! 
Read more
articles.title: Pick up an MSI RX 6800 16GB graphics card for £430 in this UK deal

articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.description:
If you woke up in a mysterious mansion, with no memory of how you got there and only a walkie-talkie and a bunch of security cameras for company, how d'you reckon you'd handle it? Personally I know, sure as eggs is eggs, that I would absolutely go to pieces. I'm not hitting the end credits of The Tartarus Key in real life, but fortunately, it's a nails thriller puzzle game that fuses PS1-style retro graphics with Saw-esque murder traps. Plus, you know, it's only about six hours end to end, which isn't bad for a semi-magical kidnap plot.
In this situation I am not me, of course, but Alex Young, and Alex upon escaping a locked study (an easy warm-up puzzle involving postcards) she finds and frees Torres, an ex-cop turned private detective, who sets up a base of operations around the mysterious mansions main fireplace. From there game's rhythm is clearing the different wings of the house by completing increasingly difficult puzzle rooms, each eventually culminating in finding a new person to save from a new death trap - concocting the antidote for poison or following the instructions to get through an electrocuted floor maze.
It's an odd group, but if you rescue everyone you start to see the edges of a wider story. There's a nice layering of paranoia, because most of the puzzles have an element of, for want of a better word, magic to them. One of the very first sees you tasked with getting an academic out of a living flesh-blob, and failure results in it and him vanishing into nowhere. You also find an underground lab with notes on scientific experiments, and a holding cell slash testing chamber - but given that next door is a giant meat freezer sokoban, is it not the case that the lab is just another puzzle room set? The low-poly, low-draw distance style of everything really adds to this, and you keep suspecting that some new puzzle or trap or maybe a weird murderer is going to suddenly loom out of the darkness in front of you. It's the kind of head melting I haven't had since playing Old Gods Rising.
 Read more
articles.title: The Tartarus Key review: an absolutely nails thriller-puzzler that's worth the effort

articles.author: Rachel Watts
articles.description:
I feel like claymation has always been a bit creepy, you know? Yeah, sure the Aardman films are whimsical and fun, but have you seen those early Wallace and Gromit shorts? There’s something kind of unsettling about the odd shape of Wallace’s uneven head and I've always deeply hated that you can sometimes see the subtle lines of a thumb imprint on parts of his face, like he’s been smothered inbetween the pads of two giant fingers. It’s so uncomfortable - and don’t even get me started on that monster Morph.
Ever since I first spotted the creepy Twitter gifs of claymation game Elation For The Wonder Box 6000, I’ve felt that same discomfort in the pit of my stomach. It’s not out yet, or even has a confirmed release date, but I just need people to witness this game. Like, just clicking through the screenshots make the hairs on the back of my neck stand on end. It’s awful, and wonderful. You can watch the trailer below. The bit where the lumps of clay wriggle inside the gun's bullet chambers goes through me.
Read more
articles.title: This claymation game makes me deeply uncomfortable so of course I need to play it

articles.author: Rachel Watts
articles.description:
One of my absolute favourite elements of Citizen Sleeper is how you essentially play as a nobody. When we first meet the Sleeper they've had their memories completely erased; the last thing they remember is stuffing themselves into a cargo container and shooting off into the depths of space - a last resort in wanting to escape the clutches of a scary corporation. They now find themselves on a dishevelled space station called Erlin's Eye, desperate and alone. They're essentially an empty shell, and one which you can etch your own story onto.
But it’s not their lack of personal identity that makes the Sleeper a nobody (after all, you essentially forge an identity for them as you make decisions throughout the game). It’s the realisation that, in this vast universe that developer Gareth Damian Martin has written, you’re no one. A single grain of sand in a vast desert. No one knows who you are, no one cares about you, and you’re stuck on a lawless space station, helpless, scared, and dying.
Read more
articles.title: Why Citizen Sleeper’s cast of interstellar nobodies matter

articles.author: Katharine Castle
articles.description:
Ssssh, listen, I know today's the last day of May and I've scheduled this month's RPS Game Club liveblog for a day in June, of all things, but I'm away travelling at the moment and won't be back until late tomorrow. There's a chance I could be back tomorrow afternoon, but my flight was delayed coming out and I want to be absolutely sure I'm near a desk with a solid internet connection rather than trying to chat to you all on my phone, so Friday it is. Anyway! Enough about my travel woes. Come and join us for the next RPS Game Club on Friday June 2nd at 4pm BST / 8am PDT to come and chat all things Citizen Sleeper with us. 
Read more
articles.title: Join us for the next RPS Game Club liveblog this Friday

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
Poly Bridge 3 offers up more puzzles about building bridges with goofy physics, and it's out now. The third entry follows a similar formula to the previous ones, asking you to help vehicles cross gaps from one side of the map to the other, all while constructing normal bridges, loop-de-loop bridges, drawbridges, and bridges that break everything I thought I knew about physics. All sorts of bridges; it’s in the name.

 
Read more
articles.title: Bridge-building puzzler Poly Bridge 3 is out now

articles.author: Jeremy Peel
articles.description:
“Oh yeah, we’ve got the System Shock IP,” said the insurance company. “What do you want to do with it? Do you want to make a sequel?”


It’s a question you could imagine being posed to Ken Levine, or Warren Spector, or several other notable designers who could reasonably lay claim to the legacy of Looking Glass and Irrational’s legendary immersive sims. Instead, it was asked of Stephen Kick - at the time, a recently unemployed videogame artist holidaying in a Guatemalan hostel. Up until that point, Kick had dedicated his life to creative pursuits. He had no business background, and none of the acumen required to understand contracts or negotiate licensing fees. More to the point, he had no more than $5,000 to his name. Hardly the foundation for a follow-up to two of the most acclaimed PC games of all time.

 
Read more
articles.title: How System Shock 2 made Stephen Kick and Nightdive Studios

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
You didn’t hear it from me, but games look different now to how they did in 1994. Mmm. Nonetheless, Nightdive Studio’s System Shock remake stays resolutely faithful to the Looking Glass original even when giving it a modern 3D makeover, with a retro flourish in its intentionally pixellated textures.
As a snappy little After Eight to the main course of Jeremy Peel’s review and OG System Shock oral history (both great, do go read those first), here’s a look at how the 2023 remake’s visuals compare to the trailblazing immsim’s previous iterations. In other words, the 2015 System Shock: Enhanced Edition, also by Nightdive, and the original. Well, System Shock Classic, which is basically the original except it runs on my PC.
Read more
articles.title: System Shock through the ages: remake, Enhanced Edition and original visuals compared

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
Xbox’s official social media channels seem to be teasing something to do with Fable. The main Xbox channel posted a clip to Twitter that moves through a house, following a glittery trail from a controller to a monitor displaying the Xbox Games Showcase art. The Fable games used sparkly breadcrumb trails as a waypoint of sorts and the clip also had some jolly fairytale music on top, leading many to guess that the long-dormant series would finally rear its head again.

 
Read more
articles.title: Xbox tease a Fable announcement ahead of showcase

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
Update: Strong Bad's Cool Game For Attractive People has been removed from sale on Steam. Meaning it's now Strong Bad's Cool Game For People Who Bought It Before June 1st. 


Original Story: Telltale can “no longer sell” the 2008 episodic comedy Strong Bad’s Cool Game For Attractive People, the developer announced in yesterday’s blog post. The studio have apparently lost the rights to the game and the series may or may not be pulled from storefronts soon, based on the slightly unclear wording of their notice. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Telltale can "no longer sell" Strong Bad's Cool Game For Attractive People

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
The world of pro wrestling slams into an SNES-era RPG with WrestleQuest, which now has a release date of August 8th. Inspired by the older Final Fantasies and Dragon Questies, you’ll be engaging in turn-based brawls and running around in magical pixel realms. But unlike those games, you’ll climb the wrestling ladder from fresh-faced rookie to world champ - instead of the usual RPG trope where you go from a village’s rat-killer to the universe’s god-killer. Watch WrestleQuest’s latest trailer below:

 
Read more
articles.title: Retro RPGs meet the world of pro wrestling in WrestleQuest, releasing this August

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Farworld Pioneers has the side-view construction and interplanetary exploration of Starbound, but adds the colony management of RimWorld. That sort of videogame-maths is useful, but in this instance it obscures the ambition of smooshing two huge games together. You should compensate for my shortcut description by watching the trailer below.

 
Read more
articles.title: Farworld Pioneers looks like a blend of RimWorld and Starbound

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
A tweet from the Xbox Australia and New Zealand account might - might! - be teasing Psychonauts 3. That's the conclusion of much of the internet, anyway. The tweet features a picture of a noughts and crosses board (aka tic-tac-toe) in which the letters for PSYCHO are written in pink and interspersed with three green Xs.

Psycho. Noughts and crosses. Three Xs. You can see where they're coming from.

 
Read more
articles.title: Xbox might be teasing Psychonauts 3 on Twitter

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Action platformer duo Ratchet & Clank have been around for over twenty years, but they're only arriving on PC for the first time on July 26th. That's when Ratchet & Clank: Rift Apart, the latest game in the series, will leap through the frequently used portal between PlayStation 5 and PC.

 
Read more
articles.title: Ratchet & Clank: Rift Apart is coming to PC in July

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Ve třetí části článku o propojení Pythonu s nativními knihovnami s využitím balíčku cffi se budeme zabývat tím, jakým způsobem je možné do funkce naprogramované v jazyku C předat pole s prvky různých typů.
articles.title: Propojení Pythonu s nativními knihovnami s využitím balíčku cffi (3)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Nová aktualizace OpenRCT2, otevřené budovatelské simulace zábavního parku. Světlo světa spatřil nový otevřený správce her Cartridges. Svobodná tahová survival hra Cataclysm: Dark Days Ahead je k dispozici na Steamu.
articles.title: OpenRCT2 umí jezdit pozpátku, nový správce her Cartridges

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: V Praze se 6. června tentokrát již osmý ročník Semináře IPv6, který pořádá sdružení CESNET. Mluvilo se o podpoře IPv6 v cloudech, zkušenostech se Starlinkem a snaze Google udělat speciální DHCPv6 pro Android.
articles.title: Android bude zřejmě umět DHCPv6, jak šlape IPv6 na Starlinku

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Sonda do světa otevřeného softwaru. Dnes si vytvoříme ozdobné nápisy z ASCII znaků, převedeme si obrázky na retro grafiku, vyzkoušíme moderní emulátor terminálů a spočítáme si odpory.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (7. 6. 2023): grafické umění ve stylu retro

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Základní struktura adresářů v unixových systémech je tu s námi od začátku sedmdesátých let, tedy vlastně asi půl století. Některé zvláštní vztahy ale vznikly spíš náhodou a po letech se začínají měnit.
articles.title: Kam mizí adresáře /bin, /sbin a /lib a proč už je nepotřebujeme?

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Cesta, která vedla od prvních reproduktorů k dnešním výkonným zvukovým čipům umožňujícím tvorbu prostorových několikakanálových zvuků a hudby založené na wavetable syntéze, byla poměrně dlouhá a především zajímavá.
articles.title: Programujeme zvuky a hudbu na ZX Spectru

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: ČD - Telematika)
articles.description: Dnes se podíváme na nechtěné přílepky některých oblíbených her na Androidu, obří únik osobních dat ve zdravotním sektoru v USA, vážnou slabinu v Apple macOS a téměř již tradiční zranitelnosti u Zyxelu.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: Android si hraje, Američané skřípou zuby a Apple bolí hlava

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Na konferenci openSUSE bylo oznámeno přejmenování edicí MicroOS Desktop. Vývoj svobodného operačního systému MINIX ustal před pěti lety. Příští rok by měla vyjít verze Ubuntu, která bude mít softwarové balíčky čistě ve formátu snap.
articles.title: Systém Minix je mrtvý, openSUSE přejmenovává MicroOS

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: S každou další verzí C++ lze víc a víc algoritmů přesunout do constexpr „domény“, kde se výpočty provádí během překladu a v runtime se již používají výsledky. Často ale vstupem do takového výpočtu je hodnota získaná až v runtime.
articles.title: C++: mapování hodnot z runtime na integrální konstanty

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Odpříště už LibreOffice jen ve Flatpaku, hlásí Red Hat, Steam na Linuxu 1,5%, čtvrtinu tvoří Steam Deck, vyšel Hangover 0.8.9, patche pro Coreboot vypínají Management Engine u Intel Raptor Lake.
articles.title: Red Hat končí s balíčkováním LibreOffice, FFmpeg 6.1 vylepšuje podporu Vulkan Video

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Po březnovém vydání významně vylepšení verze herního enginu Godot 4.0 tu máme první betu příští verze 4.1. Ta ukazuje na už relativně použitelném stavu nový vylepšený multithreating, vedoucí ke svižnějšímu běhu programu v některých aspektech, kdy engine lépe vytěžuje nové mnohojádrové procesory AMD a Intel.
articles.title: Godot 4.1 Beta 1 ukazuje vylepšený Multi-Threading

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Ve zhruba stejné doby, kdy nyní Apple oznamuje podporu JPEG XL v prohlížeči Safari, přichází do projektu frameworku FFmpeg podpora animovaných obrázků ve formátu JPEG XL.
articles.title: FFmpeg dostává podporu animovaných JPEG XL

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: honyczek)
articles.description: Komunita openSUSE vydala nové menší vydání své standardně konzervativní distribuce Leap 15.5. Ačkoliv již probíhají přípravy nové řady Leap 16, bylo o den dříve oznámeno, že uživatelé mohou počítat ještě s vydáním jedné menší verze Leap 15.6.
articles.title: openSUSE Leap 15.5: nové vydání zralé distribuce

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: V Intelu bylo vytvořeno nové písmo pod svobodnou licencí, které primárně cílí na dobrou čitelnost při vývoji kódu. Všichni programátoři tak mohou testovat Intel One Mono, font (expressive monospaced) dostupný pod SIL Open Font License 1.1. Písmo bylo vyvinuto ve spolupráci se studiem Frere-Jones Type a VMLY&R. Vývojáři by s ním měli zažívat méně únavy a dělat méně chyb při psaní kódu.
articles.title: Intel One Mono, nový typ písma speciálně pro vývojáře

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Alyssa Rosenzweig hlásí, že s ARM čipy Apple rodin M1 a M2 už je k dispozici experimentální podpora OpenGL ve verzi 3.1 a 3.0, v rámci Asahi Linuxu. Oproti dosavadní podpoře OpenGL 2.1 / ES 2.0 tak jde o významný posuv vpřed.
articles.title: Experimentální podpora OpenGL 3.1 pro Apple M1/M2

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: De facto referenční CPU dekodér video formátu AV1, projekt dav1d, má novou verzi, která zase o kus vylepšila podporu nejen instrukcí z balíku AVX-512, ale obecně SIMD. Dále Jean-Baptiste Kempf z VideoLANu dodává, že dekodér nyní potřebuje méně paměti a opraveny byly některé chyby.
articles.title: Dav1d 1.2.1 vylepšuje podpru AVX-512, už je výrazně lepší než AVX2

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Linuxových systémů přibývá, každý den se spouštějí nové servery a někdo se o ně musí starat. To znamená spoustu různých dovedností specifických právě pro linuxové prostředí. Jak to zprovoznit, kudy bezpečně dovnitř, co tam najdeme, jak se o to postaráme a jak to nastavíme nebo rozšíříme.
articles.title: Naučte se používat Linux správně a bezpečně (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nová verze webového prohlížeče Firefox 114 přináší zejména uživatelské rozhraní pro správu seznamu výjimek u DNS over HTTP. Dále v Mozille stihli vylepšit záložky o vyhledávání přímo z menu (lze jej přidat i jako tlačítko do lišty) . Nově přibylo omezení vyhledávání na lokální historii prohlížení.
articles.title: Firefox 114 s rozhraním pro správu výjimek DNS over HTTPS

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Americká Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) v pondělí informovala o dvou známých zranitelnostech firewallů Zyxel, které jsou obě aktivně zneužívány útočníky. Dostaly označení CVE-2023–33009 a CVE-2023–33010 a jde jako často o zranitelnosti typu buffer overflow, kdy útočník může dostat zařízení DoS útokem a následně na něm spouštět škodlivý kód.
articles.title: Firewally Zyxel mají aktuálně zneužívané díry, nutno okamžitě záplatovat

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Dle očekávání Apple završuje svůj přechod od architektury x86 a procesorů Intel Core / Xeon na vlastní čipy architektury ARM. Na trh míří nové stroje Apple nesoucí největší čipy rodiny M2, včetně modelu Ultra s až 24 CPU jádry, až 76 GPU jádry (9728 shader jednotek), 32 jádry pro AI výpočty a podporou až 192GB unifikované paměti s propustností 800 GB/s. To vše v celku zvícím 134 miliard tranzistorů ve dvou spojených čipech M2 Max.
articles.title: Apple definitivně skoncoval s x86, stroje s M2 Ultra nesou až 24 CPU jader a 192 GB LPDDR5

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Relativně nevýrazná je nová dílčí verze desktopu IceWM. Vydání 3.4.0 vylepšuje vlastně jen keybindings, kdy přibyla podpora pro použití kláves se Shiftem, znaky Latin-1 a všechny kódové body ze sady UTF-8. IceWM 3.4 také podporuje reparsování zkratek při změně rozložení klávesnice a přidává aktualizaci manuálu a různé menší opravy.
articles.title: IceWM 3.4 vylepšuje možnosti přiřazení kláves

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Místopředsedkyně Evropské komise pro hodnoty a transparentnost Věra Jourová dnes řekla, že by obsah generovaný umělou inteligencí měl být označený. Je to kvůli obavám ze zneužití AI k vytváření dezinformací.
articles.title: Obsah generovaný AI by měl být označený, říká Věra Jourová z Evropské komise

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: bkralik)
articles.description: Chystá se poslední jarní Virtuální Bastlírna. Nachystejte si ledové kávy, mojita a vodní chladiče a pojďte se se strahovskými bastlíři pobavit o technice a bastlení!
articles.title: Virtuální Bastlírna vol. 27: vysokofrekvenční bastlení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: xHire)
articles.description: Zítra je 6. června, což je den za skutečný internet, neboli Světový den IPv6. Jde již o tradiční příležitost urgovat svého poskytovatele připojení, kdy zavede do sítě IPv6. Je to ale také příležitost šířit osvětu i mezi netechnické uživatele. V současnosti má Česku k dispozici IPv6 jen okolo 20 % uživatelů, podle statistik společností Akamai a Google.
articles.title: Den za skutečný internet v úterý 6. června, napište svému poskytovateli

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Google Wallet na Androidu podporuje zatím digitální ID státu Maryland. V nejbližších měsících to bude platit i pro Arizonu, Colorado a Georgii. Podporován je Android 8.0 a novější a používá se rozhraní NFC.
articles.title: Google Wallet na Androidu podporuje některá digitální ID v USA

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Včera Paul Gevers oznámil, že Debian 12 Bookworm vyjde podle plánu v sobotu 10. června. A to i přes to, že je známo asi sto release-critical chyb. Většina z nich bude uvedena v poznámkách k vydání.
articles.title: Debian 12 Bookworm vyjde v sobotu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Server Phoronix minulý měsíc přinesl test kompilátorů Clang 16 a GCC 13.1 na procesoru Intel Raptor Lake. Binární soubory kompilované Clangem byly rychlejší v průměru asi o 5 % než kompilované GCC 13.1
articles.title: Clang 16 je v průměru o 4 % rychlejší než GCC 13 na Zen 4

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: V současném linuxovém jádře je jen jeden plánovač úloh a to CFS (Completely Fair Scheduler). Na CFS si občas uživatelé stěžují.  Peter Zijlstra z Intelu ve středu poslal do jádra plánovač EEVDF (Earliest Eligible Virtual Deadline First). Ten je založený na teorii z článku z roku 1996. Oproti CFS by měl mít lepší latence a menší odchylky při opakovaných měřeních.
articles.title: Nový plánovač EEVDF se chystá nahradit v jádře CFS

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Mobilní operátor T-Mobile přišel s omezenou nabídkou předplacených karet, na kterých je možné zapnout balíček se 100 GB dat za 300 korun měsíčně. Předplacenou kartu s názvem Edice 100 GB dat je možné objednávat do 30. června nebo do vyprodání zásob.
articles.title: T-Mobile nabízí předplacenku se 100 GB dat za 300 Kč měsíčně, je levnější než u O2

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Tom)
articles.description: Za týden vypukne největší bitcoinová akce v Evropě a to přímo v naší stověžaté matičce Praze. Přes 80 vystavujících firem, 100 speakerů z celého světa a mezi nimi i Michael J. Saylor, který patří mezi nejvlivnější bitcoinové maximalisty a hlavní postavy kryptosvěta. Založil společnost MicroStrategy, která pravidelně nakupuje bitcoiny na stranu firemních aktiv a která je s majetkem 140 tisíc bitcoinů z pohledu kryptoměn nejbohatší firmou světa.
articles.title: Konference BTC Prague startuje již za týden

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Vyšla verze 1.70.0 jazyka Rust. Protokol „sparse“ pro službu Cargo je nyní ve výchozím nastavení povolen pro čtení z crates.io. Tato funkce byla dříve stabilizována ve verzi 1.68.0, ale stále vyžadovala konfiguraci, aby bylo možné ji používat. V plánu bylo funkci zapnout ve výchozím stavu ve verzi 1.70.0. Výsledkem by mělo být podstatné zvýšení výkonu při načítání informací ze serveru.
articles.title: Rust 1.70.0 zrychluje práci s Cargem díky protokolu sparse

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Získejte obecný přehled o současných technikách strojového učení a naučte se programovat základní řešení ML pomocí open-source knihoven Sciki-Learn a TensorFlow v jazyce Python. Absolvujte ucelenou pětidenní sérii workshopů strojového učení, kde nejsou potřeba žádné předchozí znalosti umělé inteligence.
articles.title: Bootcamp strojového učení: praktické aplikace z oblastí zpracování obrazu, textu a časových řad (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Skrytý kód ve stovkách modelů základních desek Gigabyte neviditelně a nezabezpečeně stahuje programy – podle bezpečnostních odborníků je tuto funkci možné zneužít. Skrytý a nebezpečný mechanismus odhalili výzkumníci společnosti Eclypsium, která se zaměřuje na bezpečnost firmwaru.
articles.title: Základní desky Gigabyte obsahují ve firmwaru zadní vrátka (aktualizováno)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Společnost Brave oznámila otevření svého rozhraní Brave Search API, které zpřístupňuje vyhledávač Brave Search firmám a vývojářům po celém světě. Ti jej mohou využít při vytváření svých aplikací, které vyžadují funkci webového vyhledávání.
articles.title: Brave spouští API pro vyhledávání, s omezeními jej lze použít zdarma

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Vývojáři z AMD vydali tento týden významnou sadu změn pro grafický ovladač jádra AMDGPU. V roce 2020 společnost AMD představila režim FreeSync Video, takže uživatelské programy mohou požádat o režim videa kompatibilní s FreeSync. Zpočátku bylo k aktivaci nutné nastavit parametr modulu jádra amdgpu.experimental_freesync_video=1,  jádro 5.18 se jej snažilo povolit ve výchozím nastavení, ale vývojáři nakonec od tohoto plánu upustili.
articles.title: Ovladač AMDGPU pro Linux zapíná FreeSync a zlepšuje úsporu energie

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Přehled květnových vydání Jaderných novin: stav vydání jádra, citáty týdne a seznam článků týkajících se jádra.
articles.title: Jaderné noviny – přehled za květen 2023

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: HDMI (High-Definition Multimedia Interface) kabely jsou dnes běžně používaným propojovacím prvkem pro přenos obrazu a zvuku ve vysokém rozlišení. Tyto kabely jsou často spojovány s televizory a počítačovými monitory, ale jejich využití není omezeno pouze jen na tyto zařízení.
articles.title: HDMI kabely: K čemu slouží?

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Red Hat urychluje zavádění generativní AI v hybridním cloudu. Germanen jako cesta k energeticky úsporné elektronice?. Firmy v ČR se připravují k přechodu na novou generaci řešení SAP. Studie Cisco: přechod firem do multicloudu přináší problémy se zabezpečením přístupu uživatelů. Půl roku od uvedení ChatGPT: Umělá inteligence v centru zájmu. Soumrak nad Googlem? Analytici a trhy se neshodnou.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Soumrak nad Googlem? Analytici a trhy se neshodnou

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Co si Hawkingův spolupracovník Hertog myslí o původu času. Zachytili vzácný rozpad Higgsova bosonu. Za posledních 5 milionů let se magnetické pole Země přepólovalo 7krát. Exoplanety u červených trpaslíků. Vědci v ČR získali nejpokročilejší systém pro umělou inteligenci.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Kondenzátory na bázi polysulfátů

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Supernabídka od Goodoffer24 také v červnu. Nejzajímavější je určitě doživotní licence na Windows 10 za pouhých €12, kde zároveň připomínáme, že vám dovoluje zdarma upgradovat na Windows 11! Garantujeme 30denní záruku na nákup s možností výměny licence v případě, že by se vyskytnul nějaký problém. Také potvrzujeme excelentní nabídky na balíky Office, kdy můžete ve verzi 2016 koupit doživotní licenci jen za €23!
articles.title: Super prodej: Za doživotní licenci Windows 10 od Goodoffer24 jen €12 s možností upgradu na Windows 11, Office jen za €23 a mnoho dalšího

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Firma VMware po roce vydala nový Photon OS. Vyšel čtvrtletní Alpine Linux. Red Hat aktualizoval Enterprise Linux 8 a 9, následovaly je alternativní sestavení. Nové obrazy systému dostal Debian a řada distribucí na něm založených: Clonezilla Live, Q4OS, Raspberry Pi OS, OSMC, Tails. Desktopové edice openSUSE MicroOS byly přejmenovány.

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Acer představuje nový Swift Edge 16 s procesory AMD Ryzen řady 7040. České firmy v krizi urychlují digitalizaci. 93 % ransomwarových útoků se zaměřuje na zálohovací úložiště a vynucuje si tím zaplacení výkupného. Moderní řešení pro datacentra od Schneider Electric. CyberSecurity Podcast ProID #11: Obnova organizace po ransomware útoku. Míra zašifrování dat ransomwarem dosáhla nejvyšší úrovně za poslední 4 roky. Se společností AddAI o AI a chatbotech. Dell představuje nejnovější zařízení pro hybridní práci.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: České firmy v krizi urychlují digitalizaci

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Co říkají o Hubbleově konstantě gravitační čočky. Šíření terahertzových vln v polovodičovém krystalu. Vodíková vazba pod lupou. Černá díra, nebo bosonová hvězda? Velmi staré galaxie jsou zřejmě ještě hmotnější.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Inovace vs. vynález

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Nové směřování linuxové distribuce Solus, rekapitulace jarních vydání Ubuntu a Fedora Linuxu, výročí KaOS, pokrok blendOS a mezi tím všim pravidelné aktualizace linuxových distribucí 4MLinux, Tiny Core Linux, deepin, IPFire, Tails, Manjaro, nebo také FreeBSD a OpenBSD.
articles.title: Distribuční novinky 14-16/2023

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová stabilní verze 6.1 (aktuálně 6.1.3035.51) webového prohlížeče Vivaldi (Wikipedie). Postavena je na Chromiu 114. Přehled novinek i s náhledy v příspěvku na blogu. Nový Vivaldi se pro Bing tváří jako Microsoft Edge (upravený User-Agent) a díky tomu v něm funguje Bing Chat. Vylepšeny byly Pracovní prostory (Workspaces). Podrobný přehled v Changelogu.
articles.title: Vivaldi 6.1 se pro Bing tváří jako Microsoft Edge a díky tomu v něm funguje Bing Chat

articles.author: Pinhead
articles.description: Linuxová distribuce ArchLabs Linux po šesti letech vývoje končí. Dobbie to zabalil.
articles.title: ArchLabs končí

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: David Tschumperlé v obšírném článku se spoustou náhledů shrnuje vývoj multiplatformního svobodného frameworku pro zpracování obrazu G'MIC (GREYC's Magic for Image Computing, Wikipedie) za poslední rok a půl.

Přehled novinek v příspěvku na blogu. Na výběr jsou 4 uživatelská rozhraní: GNOME Shell, Phosh, Plasma a Sxmo. Aktuálně podporovaných zařízení je 30.

articles.author: Fluttershy, yay!
articles.description: Byla vydána distribuce openSUSE Leap verze 15.5 (poznámky k vydání). Jde o konzervativní distribuci odpovídající komerčnímu SUSE Linux Enterprise 15, nyní Service Pack 5. Mělo jít o poslední aktualizaci Leap v současné podobě před přechodem na Adaptable Linux Platform s „neměnným“ základem, ale padlo rozhodnutí, že v roce 2024 ještě vyjde Leap 15.6 s podporou do konce roku 2025.

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Alyssa Rosenzweig v příspěvku na blogu oznámila, že Asahi Linux už zvládá OpenGL 3.1. Dokončuje se podpora OpenGL ES 3.1. Dalším krokem bude Vulkan 1.0.

articles.description: Intel nedávno představil a pod licencí SIL Open Font License (OFL) na GitHubu zveřejnil font Intel One Mono. Font je určen především pro zobrazování textu v emulátorech terminálu a vývojových prostředích (Přehled fontů s pevnou šířkou).

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byl vydán Mozilla Firefox 114.0. Přehled novinek v poznámkách k vydání, poznámkách k vydání pro firmy a na stránce věnované vývojářům. Nově jsou také na Linuxu podporovány USB FIDO2/WebAuthn bezpečnostní klíče. WebTransport je ve výchozím stavu povolen. Řešeny jsou rovněž bezpečnostní chyby. Nový Firefox 114 je již k dispozici také na Flathubu a Snapcraftu.

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána červnová aktualizace aneb verze 2023.06-1 linuxové distribuce OSMC (Open Source Media Center). Z novinek lze zdůraznit povýšení verze multimediálního centra Kodi na 20. Na léto je plánováno představení nového vlajkového zařízení Vero, jež nahradí Vero 4K +.
articles.title: OSMC 2023.06-1 s Kodi 20

articles.description: While AMD 4th Gen EPYC "Genoa" and Intel 4th Gen Xeon Scalable "Sapphire Rapids" processors launched a few months ago, for those not yet able to obtain the new processors/platforms, prefer waiting for DDR5 memory prices to recede further, don't necessarily need the latest bells and whistles found with these new server processors, or just looking to maximize value, 3rd Gen AMD EPYC Milan and Intel Xeon Scalable Ice Lake processors are readily available and still seeing plenty of new deployments in data centers throughout the world. In this article is a fresh look at the AMD Milan vs. Intel Ice Lake server performance, power efficiency, and performance-per-dollar across a range of processors.
articles.title: Intel Xeon Ice Lake vs. AMD EPYC Milan Server Performance, Efficiency & Value In 2023

articles.description: Eric Engestrom has delivered another on-time release of a Mesa stable point release. Out today is Mesa 23.1.2 for delivering the latest stable bug fixes for this collection of open-source graphics driver components commonly used on Linux systems...

articles.description: Since June of last year shortly after Intel announced the Gaudi 2 AI accelerator they began posting the open-source driver patches for Gaudi 2 with the mainline Habana Labs driver. That support landed in Linux 6.0 and since then they've continued refining that support for this new processor support for deep learning training and inference workloads...
articles.title: Intel's Habana Gaudi 2 Accelerator Linux Driver In Good Shape

Following that, the Radeon ProRender plug-ins have also now finished being converted over to using HIP on AMD Radeon Vega (GFX9) GPUs and newer...

articles.description: SUSE engineer Nikolay Borisov sent out a set of patches today for "ia32_disabled" that would allow disabling of support for x86 32-bit processes from running on x86_64 Linux systems. As a first step this would be a boot-time option when "ia32_disabled" is set...

articles.description: For those using openSUSE Leap as the rock-solid, time-tested alternative to the rolling-release openSUSE Tumbleweed, today marks the availability of openSUSE Leap 15.5 as another incremental upgrade to the Leap 15 series...

This is important for Vulkan and is working with the Venus/Virgl driver context as well as Intel/AMDGPU/Freedreno native contexts too...

These newest AMD Linux patches are focused on proper heterogeneous system enumeration for AMD data center systems sporting the Instinct MI200 and newer accelerators...

articles.description: Today marks nineteen years since I started Phoronix.com for covering the Linux hardware space. It's been a wild ride from the days of 56K modems, graphics driver pains, and having to use NDISWrapper for WiFi device driver support on Linux, among many other Linux hardware pains in the early days. These days the open-source GPU driver scene is far better off, Linux hardware support overall is great, companies continue investing massively into Linux/open-source thanks to the success in the server space over the past two decades, and the Steam Deck has proven to be one of the most interesting Linux-powered consumer devices in recent years...

articles.description: Due to not having sent in any feature pull requests to DRM-Next in prior weeks due to a miscommunication, sent out today was a bit set of Intel "i915" kernel graphics driver changes targeting this next kernel cycle...
articles.title: Intel Continues Prepping Meteor Lake Graphics On Linux, Adds VRR eDP Support

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
That's a lot of armor
As part of Summer Game Fest, Nexon has shown off a slice of their upcoming smashy medieval-fantasy multi-player game, Warhaven. They have also revealed that it will be free to try out as part of Steam Next Fest.
The trailer sure is a lot. A guy gets clobbered and dies. Then he’s revived. Then things get all explodey, and a bunch of dudes get knocked around. Oh, man. It sure looks like a thing.
https://youtu.be/hiJjooA4Vlc
I had to actually turn to its now-live Steam page to really figure out what I was supposed to be seeing. Warhaven touts 36-player battles and gives emphasis to its tactical side. It looks like a MOBA, and sure enough, in the steam tags, it says MOBA. Its art style reminds me of a less grim Souls game.
Warhaven will be free-to-play, and you’ll have a chance to try it out as part of Steam Next Fest (coming next week). The full release is planned for Fall.
The post Warhaven will be playable as part of Steam Next Fest appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Warhaven will be playable as part of Steam Next Fest

articles.author: Chris Carter
articles.description:
Yep, it still looks great
Live at Summer Game Fest 2023, Remedy Entertainment game director Sam Lake took the stage to give us the elevator pitch for Alan Wake 2: one of the least necessary pitches of the modern gaming landscape. Alan Wake 2 looks fantastic so far, but at the very least, we got an actual look at gameplay today. On stage, Keighty reminds Lake that the game was teased at The Game Awards in 2021 for a "2023" release. Well, it's 2023, and it already has a date: now we know what it actually looks like.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WOr5gh2Kkqw
This is "early on" in the game, Lake confirms (in case you were worried about spoilers!), and Keighley calls it "raw unedited" footage. Saga (who has a pistol with a capacity of 12 rounds in the trailer sequence) is the core focus, as they walk up and enter an extremely creepy house, fighting off enemies in the process. There will be a "50/50 split" between the two main characters (Alan Wake and Saga Anderson), Lake says, and you can swap between them at "given points" in the story.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2hm0AmdB9AM
Alan Wake 2 is still due out on October 17, 2023 on PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X/S.
The post Alan Wake 2 footage debuts at Summer Game Fest appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Alan Wake 2 footage debuts at Summer Game Fest

articles.author: Timothy Monbleau
articles.description:
Play in Akira Toriyama's world
Summer Game Fest is here to reveal everything is has, ranging from release dates to gameplay. Since we covered the adaptation of Akira Toriyama's cult hit manga Sand Land late last year, Geoff Keighley's show's reveal of the game wasn't exactly news. However, we did receive confirmation that this upcoming adventure would launch on PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and Steam.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n-h48hdeoEM
The footage we did see showed a lot of creatures, vehicles, and creatures in vehicles. Though we didn't find firm details on the gameplay, Geoff noted "we're excited to see more of it soon" following the trailer. I guess we'll have to just wait and see to learn more! With that said, stay tuned as we learn about this upcoming title.
The post Project Sand Land is coming to PlayStation, Xbox, and PC appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Project Sand Land is coming to PlayStation, Xbox, and PC

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
I ain't fibbing
As part of this afternoon's Summer Game Fest event, publisher Neowiz Games launched a surprise demo for its upcoming Gothic fairy tale, Lies of P — The grim-looking soulslike — an adaptation of the Pinocchio fable — can be checked out right now on PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hPOdeLE6d6I
Lies of P will put players in the mechanical mantle of android boy Pinocchio, who must battle his way through the Belle Epoque city of Krat in order to reach his creator Geppetto, who has gone missing amid the darkness that is enveloping the town. Equipped with all manner of weaponry and a penchant for bending the truth, Pinocchio will face an army of nightmarish contraptions on his odyssey to find his "father" and gain true humanity.
The new demo, which is available to download right now will give interested players a chance to check out the first two chapters of the game. This will include introductions to several main characters, a feel for the general gameplay and intense combat, and a face-to-face with a few challenging bosses.
Lies of P will launch September 19 on PS5, PC, and Xbox Series X.
The post Lies of P demo available now on PC and consoles appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Lies of P demo available now on PC and consoles

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
The Blue Blur returns
Once again, Sega is going back to the start to try and remember what made everything work, with the reveal of the all-new adventure Sonic Superstars, which will launch on PC and console platforms this fall.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WOPZjphNcq4
A new trailer sees classic, 2D Sonic platforming action, brought bang up to date with gorgeous, cartoony visuals and intricately designed stages. Play as Sonic, Tails, Knuckles, and Amy Rose in single-player and co-op action, as the four friends race through brand new, but charmingly familiar new scenarios, no doubt en route to another ass-kicking showdown with Dr. Robotnik.
Sonic Superstars launches this fall on PlayStation, PC, Xbox, and Nintendo Switch.
The post Sonic Superstars will offer new thrills with old-school feels appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Sonic Superstars will offer new thrills with old-school feels

articles.author: Chris Carter
articles.description:
I hope he says lots of Matchstick Men quotes
Today at Summer Game Fest 2023, Nic Cage wandered on stage to present his upcoming Dead by Daylight cameo. Although it was teased recently, we got a full gameplay reveal, and a quick chat from the famous actor and pretty-good Elvis impersonator himself!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cXDd0kKpCDM
Cage apparently recorded lines for the game, and says he joined the project (beyond the obvious reasoning of "money!") because someone he knows is a big fan of the series. He also hopes that he's able to sufficiently immerse players with his lines and performance, which will "fuse" players and him together as one entity. Yep, it was a Nic Cage thing to say! At least we know he wasn't an AI hologram. With Geoff's access to IMAX executive money, you never know what he's capable of.
You can check out the brief new footage revealed earlier today below. Nic Cage will arrive in Dead by Daylight on July 25. That's...something I never thought I'd have to type!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gGUwWeBImdI
The post Finally, a real look at Nic Cage in Dead by Daylight appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Finally, a real look at Nic Cage in Dead by Daylight

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
Capcom Collab 1
As part of the Summer Game Fest 2023, Capcom has revealed a crossover between their upcoming Exoprimal and already game Street Fighter 6. This is in the form of just, like, robo-Ryu and cybo-Guile. In other words, Exoprimal X Street Fighter 6.
https://youtu.be/J4ULvSYsmYc
All right then.
I test-drove Exoprimal a while back and came away with stories of butts. I guess this is… more butts. But recognizable butts. I guess it could work, I’m just not really seeing the value?
If you’re into piloting Ryu and Guile’s robot butts, then you’ll be able to do so this Fall in Street Fighter. In the meantime, Exoprimal itself is out on July 14, 2023.
The post Ryu and Guile are bringing their butts to Exoprimal X Street Fighter 6 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Ryu and Guile are bringing their butts to Exoprimal X Street Fighter 6

articles.author: Timothy Monbleau
articles.description:
An alternative to Diablo 4
During Summer Game Fest 2023, we got to finally see our first footage of Path of Exile 2. While we didn't learn many new details about Grinding Gear Games' next project, its timing for this reveal couldn't be more pointed. With Diablo 4 not even a week old at this point, ARPG fans are eating good.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s65fA1urV4E
While no release date was revealed during the presentation, we did get a tease that more information would arrive on July 28. Announcements for announcements will always sound funny, but I'm plenty curious to see what's in store for us in this case. Stay tuned as we learn more.
The post Path of Exile 2 gameplay revealed, more to come on July 28 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Path of Exile 2 gameplay revealed, more to come on July 28

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Body and Soul... and bits
During Summer Game Fest, NetherRealm Studios released the first gameplay footage for its upcoming fighter Mortal Kombat 1. The sequel is coming to PlayStation, PC, and Xbox platforms this September.
The trailer gave us our first look at both the chaotic one-on-one action, as well as an all new chapter of the long-running MK story, (which is another hit on the ol' reset button). Additionally, we got confirmation that Kameo Fighters, previously referenced online, does, in fact, refer to an assist system, that will allow players to mix up their roster by calling in playable and NPC kombatants.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mV175rgyH0k
We saw veterans such as Sub-Zero, Scorpion, Johnny Cage, Liu Kang, Raiden, with assists from Kameos Sonya, Kano, Kenshi, and Jax, among others. Of course we also saw some miserably gory fatalities, along with what seems to be a return of the X-Ray mechanic, or at least some form of hard-hitting revenge system.
Mortal Kombat 1 launches September 19 on PlayStation, PC, and Xbox platforms.
The post Check out the first Mortal Kombat 1 gameplay in all of its gory glory appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Check out the first Mortal Kombat 1 gameplay in all of its gory glory

articles.author: Chris Carter
articles.description:
"A modern take on the legendary franchise"
Today at the Summer Game Fest kickoff, Geoff Keighley and company revealed Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown, a new platformer with a 2d-sidescrolling vibe. It's due out on January 18, 2024, and the listed platforms include Nintendo Switch, PC, Xbox One, Xbox Series X/S, PS4, PS5, and Amazon Luna.
Based on the footage, locomotion is an important part of the game's flow, with airdashing in clear focus. Combos are also seemingly possible, as the nimble hero Sargon is able to juggle and grappling hook enemies in, "get over here" style. Ubisoft Forward will have more info on this new entry in the Prince of Persia franchise.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MmX7a_e65uU
Welp! It's something to do before the Prince of Persia remake possibly never comes out…
articles.title: Not-E3 kicks off with Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown, a new Metroidvania

articles.author: Tiago Manuel
articles.description:
#DiabloDeaths
Hollywood star Megan Fox is now starring in the newest Diablo IV commercial. Instead of just asking players to buy Diablo IV, she's asking them to die — in the game.
She begins the video by saying "If there's one thing I love, it's the sight of blood. And in Diablo IV, there are rivers of it". This alludes to Blizzard's new campaign where Fox herself will be eulogizing the deaths of some players who use the hashtag #DiabloDeaths. The idea might sound cool, but remember that she also states that it might not be a good eulogy. It's Megan and Blizzard who will ultimately decide whether players died as heroes — or total chumps. Only time will tell!
https://twitter.com/Diablo/status/1666166527953977345?s=20
The reading of the deaths will take place on June 8
Diablo IV has been collecting critical and fan appraisal, as well as selling like hotcakes despite its high price point. Diablo IV has proven such a remarkable comeback for Blizzard that I'm unsure if this was a necessary move. The idea in itself is kind of cool, but the execution feels pretty iffy: like an extremely '90s E3 vibe? That strikes a chord with some after all the awful things we've learned about Activision Blizzard in the past couple of years.
The post Hollywood meets Hell: Megan Fox to read eulogies for Diablo 4’s fallen warriors appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Hollywood meets Hell: Megan Fox to read eulogies for Diablo 4’s fallen warriors

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Welcome back to Keigh-3
It's that time of year again, and I couldn't be more exhausted excited for it! In just about an hour from now, Geoff Keighley will take to the stage of Hollywood Park's YouTube theater for the Summer Game Fest 2023 kick-off show — An evening of exciting game trailers and picking up after yourselves.
We can expect updates, previews, and reveals from some of the biggest names in the industry, as they prod and poke our hype engines with the games that they'll be expecting $70+ for the rest of 2023 and beyond. Games set to put in an appearance include Alan Wake 2 and Baldur's Gate 2, as well as the first-ever gameplay trailer for NetherRealm Studios' Mortal Kombat 1. There are whispers of a release date for Marvel's Spider-Man 2, and we're still to see anything from Activision regarding the 2023 iteration of Call of Duty. And all this is just scratching the surface.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gY-lMH0R3AA
A pre-show will kick off about 30 minutes from now, with the presentation going live at 12:00 PT / 15:00 ET / 20:00 BST / 21:00 CEST. As always, the show will be way too long two hours in length, but we will all be on deck to bring you all of the latest news and updates, hurriedly typed and confusingly written in an all-out bid to please the Google Gods. We'd love it if you could join us for the show by following the stream above, and having your say in the comments below.
And, all jesting aside, I hope that you see at least one awesome game that gets the hype fires stoked.
The post Join us for the Summer Game Fest 2023 live stream! appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Join us for the Summer Game Fest 2023 live stream!

articles.author: Cole Travis
articles.description:
Link's (many) Adventures
The Legend of Zelda series has been going on for what seems like forever. However, the series just marked its 37th anniversary in February of 2023! With so many games released on all Nintendo Platforms, it's hard to keep track of them all. However, we've got your back.
Here's every mainline Zelda game in order of release! (Sorry Link's Crossbow Training, and Zelda CDI)
[caption id="attachment_384719" align="alignnone" width="640"] Screenshot by MobyGames[/caption]
The Legend of Zelda (NES)
Released: February 19, 1994 (Famicom)
The game that started it all. This classic 8-bit adventure saw Link roaming Hyrule and completing dungeons in order to defeat Ganon and save Zelda. While other titles have since usurped the original, it cannot be understated how much of an im…
articles.title: All mainline Zelda games in order of release date

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
The magnetism of a giant lady in a big ol' hat
Two years on from its initial release, (yep, two years), Capcom's gothic-horror title Resident Evil Village is still selling copies and scaring players worldwide — This morning, the publisher announced that the latest, (well, chronologically latest), entry in the survival horror series has surpassed eight million sales.
Resident Evil Village sees returning protagonist Ethan Winters journey into a grim European village, searching for answers following a violent attack on his home and family. There, he will encounter creatures and citizens beyond his darkest nightmare, coming face-to-face with a menagerie of monsters and demons, as well as the four lords of the land — namely Karl Heisenberg, Salvatore Moreau, Donna Beneviento & Angie, and the iconic Lady Dimitrescu, whose impact on the title's marketing, and therefore sales, cannot be overstated.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QKocYiRHYlI
Following the game's initial release in May 2021, an expansion pack, Winters' Expansion, was released in October of last year, which added new features and an additional campaign, Shadows of Rose. While the switch from "classic" Resi to the modern, first-person Resi has not been to everybody's taste, it cannot be denied that the evolution of the series has been incredibly impressive, borne out in both the critical and praise heaped upon the titles, as well as the titles' respective sales figures — A VR edition of Resident Evil Village was also developed to launch alongside the PlayStation VR2 hardware.
Resident Evil Village is available now on PlayStation, PC, Xbox, and Nintendo Switch (via cloud)
The post Resident Evil Village hits 8 million sales milestone appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Resident Evil Village hits 8 million sales milestone

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
It is way too early to think about Christmas
As part of the Guerilla Collective 2023 Showcase, Gamious has announced that there’s DLC out for delivery for their indie deliver-’em-up, Lake. Season’s Greetings serves as a prequel that will have you doling out greeting cards around the eponymous lake in Providence Oaks.
Lake: Season’s Greetings will roll the clock back eight months to before Meredith's time as temporary mail lady. You play as her father, Thomas, to whom it’s just another holiday delivery season. The developers outlined the scope of the DLC best, so I’ll pass it over to them for some bullet points.
It's the final days of the year, so expect Holiday Season happenings!
P.O. will be covered in a blanket of snow, and cheered up with lots of Christmas lighting.
Meet new characters,…
articles.title: Lake brings holiday deliveries in upcoming Season’s Greetings DLC

articles.author: Chris Carter
articles.description:
Also, Harmony: The Fall of Reverie
It's a bright day for the Nintendo eShop, and I don't just mean that figuratively: like, the marquee games on offer are literally bright and in your face!
One of the most gleaning video game franchises of all time, Katamari Damacy, is getting a remaster this week in the form of We Love Katamari Reroll + Royal Reverie. It's a re-release of We Love Katamari with extras, including the ability to play as a "young King of All Cosmos" in challenges, and a selfie photo mode. Harmony: The Fall of Reverie is out as well, and the art style alone is worth checking out.
The rest of the week is a bit less packed than normal, but that's great actually! We could use a breather after the $70 Tears of the Kingdom and the flood of other releases.
